text:
I can confidently say you can go over +90.
But it won't be easy (specially if you are not building from scratch and just want to optimize a published website), and you will have to limit yourself on functionalities too like: too many CTAs, forms, smart content rules (on the same page), excesive amount of JavaScript and images, etc.
We did build our template from scratch (<http://www.addmark.nl|www.addmark.nl>) but are not getting the 90+. I think it has to do with the CTA buttons etc.
But besides that, I am not quite sure were to improve

Hi all, I have a question. Do you know if it’s possible to change the location of the HubSpot chat symbol/widget other than ‘left’ and ‘right’ in the HubSpot environment or to make the iframe smaller in size? The chat symbol is in front of a button in our app that now cannot be clicked. Any idea’s / suggestions?

Well, CLS has nothing to do with HubSpot server really. A 5.1s on Time to Interactive seems a huge hit also.
Dropping some common things:
• Defer/async your JS (non priority wich is likely to be 99% of it). 
• Avoid if you can jQuery, or at leats find a cropped version of it with the only things you are actually using on your website (instead of the defualt from HubSpot).
• Double check your images sizes and format (use SVG & webP mostly).
• Lazy load all your images below the fold.
• Priorize your CSS for mobile

If anyone uses workflows to send NPS ratings to a webhook url, i solved my issue. I added a 15 minute delay between receiving the NPS rating and sending it to my webhook. It seems NPS ratings in particular get parsed by HubSpot and dont appear right away.
